data.title: Readability

testCases.title: Grade 4
testCases.testIn: I like to correct clashes in my spare time. It is fun and it helps the CodinGame community. What about you, my friend?

testCases.title: Grade 2
testCases.testIn: Would you like them here or there? I would not like them here or there. I would not like them anywhere.

testCases.title: Grade 3
testCases.testIn: Congratulations! Today is your day. You're off to Great Places! You're off and away!

testCases.title: Grade 5
testCases.testIn: Harry Potter was a highly unusual boy in many ways. For one thing, he hated the summer holidays more than any other time of year. For another, he really wanted to do his homework, but was forced to do it in secret, in the dead of the night. And he also happened to be a wizard.

testCases.title: Grade 7
testCases.testIn: In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.

testCases.title: Grade 8
testCases.testIn: Alice was beginning to get very tired of sitting by her sister on the bank, and of having nothing to do: once or twice she had peeped into the book her sister was reading, but it had no pictures or conversations in it, "and what is the use of a book," thought Alice "without pictures or conversation"?

testCases.title: Grade 16+
testCases.testIn: A large class of computational problems involve the determination of properties of graphs, digraphs, integers, arrays of integers, finite families of finite sets, boolean formulas and elements of other countable domains.

testCases.title: Grade 31
testCases.testIn: Photosynthesis seen amongst vegetables demonstrate possibilities to decarbonize the atmosphere.

testCases.title: Grade 1-
testCases.testIn: One fish. Two fish. Red fish. Blue fish.

testCases.title: Validator - Grade 1-
testCases.testIn: Bird fly. Fish fly. I cry.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In readability, your task is to make a program that takes text as input,
and outputs the approximate level of that text
the approximate level of a text is:

grade = (0.0588 * average letters) - (0.296 * average sentences) - 15.8
Where :
letters is the amount of alphabet letters in the text, case insensitive
words is the amount of words (always separated by an optional punctuation then a space)
sentences is the amount of sentences (always separated by !, ?, or .)
average letters = letters / words * 100.0
average sentences = sentences / words * 100.0

If the grade's value ≤ 1, output Grade 1-
If the grade's value ≥ 16, output Grade 16+
If the grade's value is between 1 and 16, print the rounded value of grade.

Example:
If the text is: One fish. Two fish. Red fish. Blue fish.
So the count of letters count = 29, words count = 8, sentences count = 4, where every sentence ends at "?" or "!" or "."
And average letters = (29 / 8) * 100 = 362.5
and average sentences = (8 / 4) * 100 = 50.0
and grade = round((0.0588 * 362.5) - (0.296 * 50.0) - 15.8) = -9

The grade < 1, so the output will be: Grade 1-
Input
Line 1: A string text
Output
Line 1: The approximate grade of that text
Constraints
1 < text's length < 301
Example
Input
I like to correct clashes in my spare time. It is fun and it helps the CodinGame community. What about you, my friend?
Output
Grade 4
